data: {"concept_id": "period", "concept_name": "Period", "set": "Grammar & Punctuation", "type": "element", "definition": "Full stop: closure mark that sets rhythm, tone, and sentence boundaries in print and digital registers.", "axes": "use|tone_effect|pacing|digital_register|style_caps", "axis_values": "declarative_end|imperative_end|indirect_question|abbreviation | neutral|firm|cold|final | staccato|measured|rolling | chat_breezy|chat_formal | cap_after_full_sentence|lowercase_style", "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"concept_id": "period", "error_id": "missing_period", "description": "Run-ons or breathless sprawl from missing full stops.", "fixit": "End units of thought with periods; test aloud.", "example_fix": "Split into sentences at natural completions.", "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"concept_id": "period", "error_id": "period_overuse", "description": "Choppy monotone from too many short sentences.", "fixit": "Vary with coordination/subordination or dashes/semicolons.", "example_fix": "Combine adjacent sentences where ideas link.", "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"concept_id": "period", "error_id": "abbrev_confusion", "description": "Treating abbreviation dots as sentence stops.", "fixit": "Follow style guide for spacing/caps; watch sentence boundary.", "example_fix": "e.g., etc., i.e., U.S.", "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"concept_id": "period", "error_id": "ellipsis_misuse", "description": "Using ... when a period is needed or vice versa.", "fixit": "Pick ellipsis for omission/hesitation; period for closure.", "example_fix": "Replace decorative dots with a period.", "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"blueprint_id": "bp_period_rhythm", "concept_id": "period", "cognitive_goal": "revise", "task_type": "transform", "prompt_template": "Rescore a paragraph’s rhythm by redistributing periods (staccato → measured → rolling) without adding content.", "expected_features": "Tone/pacing shifts are audible and intentional.", "scoring_method": "pattern|rubric", "rubric_levels": {"Exceeds": "Accurate + justified", "Meets": "Mostly correct", "Developing": "Vague/incorrect"}, "variation_axes": "use|tone_effect|pacing|digital_register|style_caps", "difficulty": 2, "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}

{"blueprint_id": "bp_period_chat_tone", "concept_id": "period", "cognitive_goal": "analyze", "task_type": "classify", "prompt_template": "Given text messages with/without periods, label tone effect (breezy vs firm/cold) and justify.", "expected_features": "Calls match register conventions with evidence.", "scoring_method": "pattern|rubric", "rubric_levels": {"Exceeds": "Accurate + justified", "Meets": "Mostly correct", "Developing": "Vague/incorrect"}, "variation_axes": "use|tone_effect|pacing|digital_register|style_caps", "difficulty": 2, "source_file": "Period.md", "source_md5": "223404326e9340d62ea64c9af96fe3f2", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}
